results.title: The Honest truth
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “What Do You Think”.
This film poses the question of whether an honest judgment is better than diplomatic double-talk in situations where an individual’s feelings may be hurt. We listen in on the conversation of high-school teen-agers following a school play in which a popular but untalented student has the leading role. The editor of the school paper defends his right to print an objective critical review of her performance. Other students feel that she should be let down more gently. The audience is invited to take over discussion of the issue.

results.title: Hommage: Francois Couperin
results.brief_description: Animated butterfly ballet suggested by the title of the 17th century French composer’s “Les Papillons”. The film reflects the animator’s admiration of Chinese and Japanese painting as well as of the composer’s music. The animation employs a device similar to stroboscopic or multi- image photography, that creates a smooth and fluid flow of motion, making the delicate choreography beautifully evident.

results.title: The Homicide story
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions and HSV Channel 7, Melbourne
results.brief_description: The story of the making of one episode of the successful Australian television series - Homicide. From the idea for a story in the mind of a writer to the finished product - a matter of fourteen weeks intensive planning and work. We follow all steps of production: from the writing of the script to the final telerecording of thirty minutes of television.

results.title: Homework: studying on your own
results.brief_description: Shows three areas in which homework skills are necessary - handling problems of a place and time to study; scheduling and arranging projects according to materials needed for study, and developing the habits of studying “on your own”. The significance of homework to success in college, business and adult life is also explained.

results.title: Homes from home: caring for children
results.creator_credit: Gordon Croton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Documentary series aimed at social workers. This episode deals with the caring of children in institutions prior to them either going back to their family homes or into foster care.

results.title: Homecraft in Sweden
results.brief_description: Describes the many aspects of handicrafts in Sweden and shows how these have strong roots in the traditions of the ocuntry. Amongst the handicrafts shown are: upholstery making, carpet making, lace making, weaving, basket making, knitting, iron work, and pottery. Describes the techniques used in these crafts and shows numerous examples of the quality of the work produced.

results.title: Home sweet home
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the organisation and effort required to reconstruct Darwin after it had been destroyed by Cyclone Tracy on Christmas Day, 1974. Illustrates the social impact of the cyclone.

results.title: Home of the Kodavas
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Life in the little known state of Coorg in South India. The martial Kodavas, their quaint customs and simple pleasures. Coorg, nestling in a chain of hills, abounds in fertile fields and luxuriant jungles. A land of streams and rivers, including Kaveri the sacred river of the south.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A. Bhaskar Rao, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: The Home made car
results.brief_description: Follows the rebuilding of an old Morris car in a home workshop, without commentary. The story of the man, his dog, and a dream which includes the girl next door, a torrid ten year old, a garage man and, of course, “the car”.

results.title: Homage to Verdi
